comments:
It seems the class org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.dialogs.StatusDialog has been 
removed instead of just marked as deprecated. This causes the deployment dialog 
of the JBoss IDE plugin (using the latest version 1.4.1.e31 running Eclipse on 
JRE 1.5.0_03) to fail on some dialog screens. Stack trace from error log below; 
the central part is

Root exception:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/jdt/internal/ui/dialogs/StatusDialog

I observed the error when choosing "Window", "Preferences", "JBoss-IDE", 
"Deployer"; others on the JBoss bug reporting site have reported it for the 
XDoclet subtree threre as well, but I don't experience it there in the version I 
use.

The bug would possibly also break other plugins that rely on the class.

Here's the trace:

org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.jboss.ide.eclipse.deployer.

As the package name of this class indicates StatusDialog is an internal class.
It's not official API. We only guarantee API stability for API classes not for
internal implementations of the API. So please report the bug against the JBoss
IDE (as a side note: the StatusDialog class is now official API in
org.eclipse.jface.dialogs).
